prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End** The first part of the CAD assembly is a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: Coordinate System: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0055, 0.75, 0.0] Next, create the sketch for the part on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of four faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, face\\_3, and face\\_4) and each face contains one loop, made up of lines and arcs. Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0833], End Point [0.0862, 0.0833] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0862, 0.0833], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.0741], End Point [0.1409, 0.0833] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1409, 0.0833], End Point [0.2272, 0.0833] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.2272, 0.0833], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.0833] Face 2: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1548], End Point [0.0862, 0.1548] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0862, 0.1548], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.1641], End Point [0.1409, 0.1548] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1409, 0.1548], End Point [0.2272, 0.1548] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.2272, 0.1548], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.2381], End Point [0.0, 0.1548] Face 3: - Loop 1: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0862, 0.0833], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.0741], End Point [0.1409, 0.0833] - Line 1: Start Point [0.1409, 0.0833], End Point [0.0862, 0.0833] Face 4: - Loop 1: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0862, 0.1548], Mid Point [0.1136, 0.1641], End Point [0.1409, 0.1548] - Line 1: Start Point [0.1409, 0.1548], End Point [0.0862, 0.1548] Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.2381. After scaling, transform the sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.75 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. This operation creates a new solid body. The length, width, and height of the part are 0.2381, 0.75, and 0.2381, respectively, as described in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism Base** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This will be the base for our CAD model. 2. **Draw the first face** of the rectangular prism: - Start by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). - Then, draw a line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.15). - Next, draw a line from (0.75, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.3899). - Finally, close the loop by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.3899) back to (0.0, 0.0). 3. **Draw the second face** of the rectangular prism: - This face mirrors the first face, so create a line from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). - Then, draw a line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.15). - Next, draw a line from (0.75, 0.15) to (0.0, 0.3899). - Close the loop by drawing a line from (0.0, 0.3899) back to (0.0, 0.0). 4. **Scale the entire sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D**: - Set the euler angles as specified in the coordinate system [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. - Apply the translation vector [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** to create a 3D object with an extrusion depth of 0.75 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. This will be the base part of our assembly. **Model description:** Shape: Rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. Length: 0.75 Width: 0.75 Height: 0.75</description>
